---
title: "Data visualization in R"
author: "Angelika Merkel"
---

This workshop introduces data visualization in R with the ggplot2 package for [Beginners]{.underline}. After this course you should have a good understanding of the 'Grammar of Graphics' and sufficient knowledge to create your own plots (visualizations) with ggplot2.

**Topics covered:**

-   Why use ggplot2?
-   Base R and the tidyverse
-   The Grammar of Graphics
-   Practical session:
    -   building up a plot
    -   mappings and layers
    -   groupings
    -   scaling
    -   formatting

**Course materials:**

-   [Course presentation](data/Data_visualization_in_R.April2025.pdf)

For this course we follow several chapters from the book [R for Data Science (2nd edition)](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/) by *Wickham et al*. This includes the practical session and exercises.
